channel.title: Enterprise on iustinian-olaru
channel.description: Recent content in Enterprise on iustinian-olaru

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Implementation projects:

  • Experiment Project at the Cognition and Behavior Laboratory in Aarhus : An independent project aimed at testing heart rate synchronization during shared activities, utilizing Wii remotes and biometric data collection.

  • Message Queue System Framework at Novicell : Developed a RabbitMQ message system library for an API during a second internship.

  • Flight Assistant Project at QuadSat : Combined a drone and payload with a Python-based desktop application and AWS-backed serverless cloud solution for satellite companies.

item.title: Enterprise Process Modeling Platform
item.description:
Overview:

During my time at Ramboll, I worked closely with the team responsible for maintaining a decade‑old Python/Django risk management platform used across several business units. Over the years, the system had accumulated significant technical debt, with inconsistent modules, tightly coupled logic, and architectural limitations inherent to the framework and language. As new enterprise‑level requirements emerged, it became increasingly clear that the legacy platform could no longer support scalable, type‑safe, and maintainable domain modeling. In response, leadership approved a greenfield initiative—internally referred to as the Data Workbench—aimed at building a modern enterprise process‑modeling platform informed by the lessons learned from maintaining the legacy codebase.
